intro: Echinops antalyensis, commonly known as the Antalya thistle, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, spherical seed heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing drought-resistant adaptations. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a rough texture, and it produces yellow flowers in the summer months. Echinops antalyensis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive appearance and hardy nature.
